title: Handle an Angry Call from a Story Subject
description: A person who was the subject of a critical story calls the newsroom, angry about their portrayal. An editor must handle the call.

tasks.description: Listen patiently to the caller's complaints without interrupting.
Ask the caller to specify which parts of the story they believe are factually inaccurate.
tasks.expected_outcome: The editor focuses the conversation on specific, verifiable facts rather than general anger.

tasks.description: Promise to review their claims of inaccuracy with the reporter and check the source material.
tasks.expected_outcome: The editor commits to a review process.

tasks.description: If an error is found, initiate the corrections process. If not, politely stand by the story.
tasks.expected_outcome: An informed decision is made and communicated to the caller.
